gurmukhi: ਅੌਰ ਸਕਲ ਗਨ ਚਲੇ ਸੁ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੰਭਾਰ ਕੈ || ਹੋ ਕੌਨ ਅਜਿਤ ਪ੍ਰਗਟਯੋ ਭਵ ਕਹੈਂ ਬਿਚਾਰ ਕੈ ||੧੫੦੦||
transliteration: Aur Sakal Gad Chale Su Shastra Sanbhaar Kai|| Ho Kaoun Ajit Pragtyo Bhav Kahain Bichaar Kai||1500||
translation: All other ganas, taking up their weapons, moved along; they were all thinking as to who was that mighty hero born in the world, for killing whom, they had been called.1500.

gurmukhi: ਕੋ ਭਟ ੳੁਪਜਿਯੋ ਜਗਤ ਮੈਂ ਸਭ ਯੌ ਕਰਤ ਬਿਚਾਰ || ਸ਼ਿਵ ਸਿਖਿ ਬਾਹਰ ਗਨ ਸਹਿਤ ਅਾੲੇ ਰਨ ਰਿਸਿ ਧਾਰ ||੧੫੦੧||
transliteration: Ko Bhat Oupjiyo Jagad Main Sabh Yooun Karat Bichaar|| Shiv Sikh(i) Baahar Gad Sahit Aae Ran Ris(i) Dhaar||1501||
translation: All of them are thinking as to who can be that mighty one born in the world; the god Shiva and his ganas, in their fury, came out of their abodes.1501.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਲੈ ਕਾਲ ਕਰਤਾ ਜਹੀਂ ਅਾੲੇ ਤਿਹ ਜਾ ਦੌਹ || ਰਨ ਨਿਹਾਰ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਕਹਿਯੋ ੲਿਹ ਚਿੰਤਾ ਕੀ ਠੌਰ ||੧੫੦੨||
transliteration: Pralai Kaal Kartaa Jaheen Aae Tih Jaa Daur|| Ran Nihaar Man Mai Kahiyo Eh Chintaa Kithaur||1502||
translation: When the god of dissolution came himself in the battlefield, them the field itself indeed became the field of anxiety.1502.

gurmukhi: ਗਨ ਗਨੇਸ਼ ਸ਼ਿਵ ਖਟ ਬਦਨ ਦੇਖੈ ਨੈਨ ਨਿਹਾਰ || ਸੋ ਰਿਸ ਭੂਪਤਿ ਜੁੱਧ ਹਿਤ ਲੀਨੇ ਅਾਪ ਹਕਾਰ ||੧੫੦੩||
transliteration: Gad Gadesh Shiv Khat Badan Dekhai Nain Nihaar|| So Ris Bhoopat(i) Juddh Hit Leene Aap Hakaar||1503||
translation: Already when Ganesh, Shiva, Dattatreya and ganas were viewing the battlefield, there and then the king himself challenged them to fight.1503.

gurmukhi: ਰੇ ਸ਼ਿਵ ਅਾਜ ਅਯੋਧਨ ਮੈ ਲਰਿ ਕੈ ਹਮ ਸੋ ਕਰ ਲੈ ਬਲ ਜੇਤੋ || ਅੈ ਰੇ ਗਨੇਸ਼ ਲਰੈਂ ਹਮਰੇ ਸੰਗ ਹੈ ਤੁਮਰੇ ਤਨ ਮੈ ਬਲ ੲੇਤੋ ||
transliteration: Re Shiv Aaj Ayodhan Mai Lar(i) Ham So Kar Lai Bal Jeto|| Ooi Re Gadesh Darain San Hai Toumre Tan Mai Bal Eto||
translation: “O Shiva ! whatever strength you have today, use it in this war; O Ganesh ! do have so much strength as to fight with me?

gurmukhi: ਕਿੳੁ ਰੇ ਖੜਾਨਨ ਤੂੰ ਗਰਬੈ ਮਰ ਹੈ ਅਬਹੀ ੲਿਕ ਬਾਨ ਲਗੈ ਤੋ || ਕਾਹੇ ਕੳੁ ਜੂਝ ਮਰੋ ਰਨ ਮੈ ਅਬ ਲੳੁ ਨ ਗਯੋ ਕਛੁ ਜੀਅ ਮਹਿ ਚੇਤੋ ||੧੫੦੪||
transliteration: Kio Re Khadaanan Toon Gadbai Mar Hai Ab-hiik Baan Lagad To|| Kaahe Kau Joojh Daro Ran Mai Ab Lau Na Gado Kachh(u) Jeea Maih Cheto1504||
translation: “Hello Kartikeya ! for what you are becoming egoistic? You will be killed with one arrow; still nothing has gone wrong, why do you want to die while fighting in the war?”1504.
Speech of Shiva addressed to Kharag Singh:

gurmukhi: ਬੋਲਿ ੳੁਠਯੋ ਰਿਸਿ ਕੈ ਸ਼ਿਵਜੂ ਅਰੇ ਕਿੳੁ ਸੁਨ ਤੂੰ ਗਰਬਾਤੁ ਹੈ ੲੇਤੋ || ੲੇਤਨ ਸਿੳੁ ਜਿਨ ਰਾਰ ਮੰਡੋ ਅਬਿ ਹੀ ਲਖਿ ਹੈ ਹਮ ਮੈ ਬਲੁ ਜੇਤੋ ||
transliteration: Bol(i) Outhyo Ris(i) Shivjoodare Kio Soun Toon Gadbaat(u) Hai Eto|| Etan Sio Jin Raar Mando Ab(i) Hilakh(i) Hai Ham Mai Bal(u) Jeto||
translation: Shiva spoke in anger, “O king ! why are you so proud? Do not indulge in strife with us; you will see just now what strength we have!

gurmukhi: ਜੋ ਤੁਮ ਮੈ ਅਤਿ ਪੳੁਰਖ ਹੈ ਅਬ ਢੀਲ ਕਹਾ ਧਨ ਬਾਨਹ ਲੇਤੋ || ਜੇਤੋਹੈ ਦੀਰਘ ਗਾਤ ਤਿਹਾਰੋ ਸੁ ਬਾਨਨ ਸੋ ਕਰਿ ਹੋ ਲਹੁ ਤੇਤੋ ||੧੫੦੫||
transliteration: Jo Toum Mai At(i) Paurakh Hai Ab Dheel Kahaa Dhan Baanah Leto|| Jeto-haai Deeragh Gadt Tihdaro Su Baanan So Kar(i)dholauh Teto||1505||
translation: “If you have greater courage, then why are you delaying, why do you not take your bow and arrows in your hands? You have a very large body and by piercing it with my arrows, I shall lighten it.”1505.
Speech of Kharag Singh addressed to Shiva:
